7. The structure of meaning as such is an ex-sistential. Ex-sistence is engagement with the world of meaning; i.e., the world of meaning is an ex-sistential, a fundamental way we are. Thus, in analyzing the world of meaning, we are analyzing ex-sistence.
Our approach is through things. Nonetheless, we will approach the world of meaning (1) through things within the world of meaning and (2) in terms of the being of those things, i.e., how they are meaningfully present. But in order to do so, we first need some important clarifications.
